result.execSummary:
The defendant RANDY J. VANDENBERG was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprints and photograph pursuant to Wis. Stats. 970.02(7).  IMMEDIATELY following court, contact (920) 236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Arrangements to complete collection shall be made within 72 hours.  At time of appointment, Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.
Defendant shall set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office immediately. Failure to do so shall result in a Judgment being placed against the Defendant for any outstanding amount.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. RANDY J. VANDENBERG

records.addlTxt: 10:00 AM Defendant RANDY J. VANDENBERG in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.

DC/DV: CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety. No alcohol consumption or possession. No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing. No contact with V1 or their residence in Menasha PD report 22-1764 or with B.J.V. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.
***8/10/22  Amend No contact with V1 and B.J.V. to No violent contact with V1 or B.J.V.  Remove no contact with V1's residence.***

9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant RANDY J. VANDENBERG in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Request to amend bond conditions - no objection from the State.  Court will amend bond.The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant RANDY J. VANDENBERG in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Advised of and waives rights.  Copy of complaint received by Def.  Plea entered. Marcy's law complied with. Bond continues.  Defendant would like bond modified.  Set for hearing.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Further proceedings hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. Record closed @ 258
